medical_history.chief_complaint: Intractable pain in the feet, legs, and hips.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Developed within 2â€“3 months after starting insulin therapy. Pain characterized as burning and aching with tenderness bilaterally in the feet and legs. The patient was very distressed, tearful, and confined to bed, unable to sleep. Pain slightly eased with Advil taken two to three times per day.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 1 diabetes for 6 years, eating disorder (anorexia/bulimia), grand mal seizures controlled with lamotrigine.
medical_history.family_history: Older sister with anxiety, mother with Hashimoto thyroiditis and rheumatoid arthritis, maternal grandmother with Hashimoto thyroiditis and diabetes, paternal grandfather with myocardial infarction, paternal side history of lung cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked a pack of cigarettes a day for 5 years, quit in November 2008. Attended college and lived at home with parents. Did not consume alcohol or use illegal drugs. No exposure to heavy metals or organotoxins.
